result.execSummary:
The defendant Londen D Morton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail of $350 applied. Balance to be paid within 90 days or penalty of 2 days Huber for non-payment. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
Court grants 3 days credit. TIME SERVED.

records.addlTxt: End of representation letter, dated 11/1/19, filed by Atty. Kegel.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

09:02 AM Defendant Londen D Morton in court with attorney Katie B. Kegel.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kegel presents the offer.  Atty. Pitzo confirms the offer as placed on the record.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders case 18CM1334 dismissed and read into this case.  State presents their recommendations for sentencing.  Atty. Kegel presents her recommendations for sentencing.  The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1:

3 DAYS JAIL (3 Days Credit) **TIME SERVED**

COURT COSTS: $253.00 (Includes DRGOD surcharge);

DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00;
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

COURT TO APPLY THE $250.00 cash bail on deposit in this case and the $100.00 cash bail on deposit in case 18CM1334 towards costs; remainder to be paid within 90 Days or serve 2 days jail, with Huber, as penalty for non payment of fine.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2019 at 08:30 am.

01:43 PM Defendant Londen D Morton in court with attorney Katie B. Kegel.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Kegel advises the court of the status of the case and is requesting a plea and sentencing date as soon as possible for an 8:30 time slot.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 14, 2019 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.

Court will adjourn for status of counsel/further proceedings in about 30 days.  Defendant was provided with the information sheet with regards to the Public Defender's location in court today.
